title: Strengthening Machine Learning Practical Competencies: Design and Implementation of Distributed-Parallel Computing Frameworks

context.prior_knowledge: Programming fundamentals (JavaScript), database concepts, and basic computing architecture understanding
context.additional_context: Advanced AI/machine learning technical course for AI/ML practitioners

learning_goals: Instructors can design task distribution and communication mechanisms in hybrid distributed-parallel environments
Developers can implement large-scale simulation tasks using JavaScript VM and web browser-based tools
Integrate a custom SQL database-based data management system into a parallel computing environment
Apply control path/data path-level parallelization strategies to real-world problems

Within 2 weeks, learners identify 3 types of synchronization issues (deadlock, livelock, race conditions) in distributed systems using Python or Go, write solutions using semaphores or mutex techniques, and verify correct operation through test cases.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
